wikipedia_page.main: Jermaine Barrington Anderson (born 16 May 1996) is an English professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for National League club Woking.

response: Jermaine Anderson (born February 8, 1983) is a Canadian retired professional basketball player. He is a veteran member of the Canadian national basketball team.
On August 2, 2013, he signed a one-year deal with TBB Trier.TBB Trier signs Jermaine Anderson On August 11, 2014, he re-signed with Trier for one more season.TBB Trier re-signs Jermaine Anderson

On August 28, 2015, he signed with Baloncesto Sevilla of the Spanish Liga ACB.Baloncesto Sevilla tabs Jermaine Anderson On January 19, 2016, he parted ways with Sevilla after appearing in 15 games.Baloncesto Sevilla part ways with Jermaine Anderson and Uros Slokar Anderson leaves Sevilla On February 2, 2016, he returned to his former team Basketball Löwen Braunschweig for the rest of the season.Jermaine Anderson inks with Basketball Löwen Braunschweig

On August 18, 2016, Anderson signed with the French team Châlons-Reims. On January 19, 2017, he left Châlons-Reims and signed with Montenegrin club Mornar Bar. He left Mornar after appearing in six games. In April 2017, he returned to Châlons-Reims for the rest of the season.Jermaine Anderson back at Chalons-Reims

link_mentions.page: List of Bradford City A.F.C. players (1–49 league appearances)

response: Colchester's winless run continued on 23 August as they were defeated 1–0 at home by Doncaster Rovers. They then suffered another home defeat as Peterborough United won 3–1 at the Colchester Community Stadium. Peterborough took a two goal lead before half-time, but Freddie Sears pulled one back on 64-minutes. However, Jermaine Anderson scored 13-minutes from time to seal the victory.

On 20 June 2015, Fox was signed by League One side Peterborough United along with Irishman Kieran Sadlier and Ivorian Souleymane Coulibaly. His debut came on 24 October 2015 as a 67th minute substitution, on for Jermaine Anderson in a 4–0 win against Doncaster Rovers. He scored his first goal for the club on 16 April 2016 having only been on pitch two minutes in the 4–1 win at Colchester, a right footed shot from 8-yards to put them 2–0 up.
